rxp_file Creates a Nix expression that reads in a file.

Source: R/derivs.R
rxp_file.Rd

rxp_file Creates a Nix expression that reads in a file.

Usage

rxp_file(name, path, read_function, nix_env = "default.nix")

Arguments

name

Symbol, the name of the derivation.

path

Character, the file path to include, can be an url.

read_function

Function to read in the data, must be a function of only one argument, the path. If you wish to pass several arguments to this function, make it an anonymous function.

nix_env

Character, path to the Nix environment file, default is "default.nix".

Value

A list with elements: name, the derivation name, snippet, the generated Nix code, type, and nix_env.

Details

The function must only take one single argument, the path to the file to read. Because of this limitation, if you need to pass more than one argument to the function, make it an anonymous function, for example: d0 <- rxp_file(mtcars, 'mtcars.csv', \(x) (read.csv(file = x, sep = "|")))

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
rxp_file(data, "./data.csv", read.csv)
} # }
